result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary R Faught was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

superAgency.notes: Until 4/27/16 as conditions listed on agreement

miscConds.notes:
Must comply with current child support order in place. 
Must pay child support and arrearages in full and on time each month. 
Must apply for jobs 5 times per week and provide documentation to the Child Support Agency and Probation Agent. 
Must report any change of address, phone or employment to the Child Support Agency within 48 hours. 
Must maintain full time employment. 
Must seek work diligently if unemployed or underemployed.
Order for DNA to be sent down to the Barron County Jail. Must submit sample immediately.  Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 145 days credit if revoked from probation

Clerked by CR. 
11:49 AM Defendant Gary R Faught in court with attorney Andrew T Knaak.  Defendant Gary R Faught in custody.  Brian H. Wright appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gary R Faught appeared by video means with Attorney.  Covers 15CF378 (Plea/Sentencing), 20CF127, 20CF128 (Initial Appearances).  State recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

15CF378 - Guilty plea entered

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  State relates.  Attorney Knaak relates. Court relates and orders:

SW 
3 years probation
Must comply with current child support order in place.
Must pay child support and arrearages in full and on time each month.
Must apply for jobs 5 times per week and provide documentation to the Child Support Agency and Probation Agent.
Must maintain full-time employment.
Must report any change of employment, phone number, or address to the Child Support agency within 48 hours
Must seek work diligently if unemployed or underemployed.
Must submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Restitution of $1,237.05 for transport from the State of Illinois on the warrant per C-31 that is to be filed.
Costs including DNA surcharge.
145 days jail credit if Probation is revoked.  

Order for DNA to be sent down to the defendant in jail. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

20CF127 and 20CF128 - Address updated in 20CF127 and Defendant will call the clerks office with a cell phone number upon release from Jail.  Time limits waived.  Court questions Defendant and finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.  Preliminary Hearings set for both files for 5/15/2020 at 9:00 a.m. in person or by Zoom or telephone.  JA TO SEND NOTICES OF HEARING.  Bond set that covers both files.

SCANNED TO BARRON COUNTY JAIL  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2020 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Knaak requests reset to next week.  Court sets plea hearing.
